How Jekyll Rock (With Style)

Published the 19 January 2013 by Thomas Romera

Some days ago, I told that I was working on a new blog. I also talked about Jekyll, a new system that allow you to make a great site (Static).

Jekyll is a simple, blog aware, static site generator. With it special directory structure, it allow you to write your article through Textile or Markdown, coupled with Liquid to create some “Dynamic content” and compile everything.
So, you can host your blog on Github for 0 $. Yes, 0 $. More informations on the Official GitHub documentation !
Jekyll can be installed with a simple gem install jekyll

Be sure to install the right version, some compatibility issue can make you loose some time :

gem ‘jekyll’, ‘=0.12.0’
gem ‘liquid’, ‘=2.4.1’
gem ‘redcarpet’, ‘=2.1.1’
gem ‘maruku’, ‘=0.6.0’
gem ‘rdiscount’, ‘=1.6.8’
gem ‘RedCloth’, ‘=4.2.9’

Then, I just used this fantastic website : Skeleton for Jekyll using Bootstrap that let you fork a Jekyll skeleton with Bootstrap installed, comments, analytics, and a lot of good stuff. After that, I just created a new theme for Jekyll to integrate Foundation instead of Bootstrap.

All my website is on my Github, you can find it here : My Github.
Feel free to Fork, modify, share !

See you !
